required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Efficacy and Safety of OXC XR as Adjunctive Therapy for Partial Seizures
clinical_study.official_title: Phase III Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of OXC XR as Adjunctive Therapy in Subjects With Refractory Partial Seizures

brief_summary.textblock: Evaluation of the safety and efficacy of Oxcarbazepine XR as adjunctive treatment for adults with partial onset seizures

detailed_description.textblock: Multicenter, double-blind, randomized, placebo-controlled, three-arm. parallel-group study of the efficacy and safety of extended-release oxcarbazepine in the treatment of adults with refractory partial onset epilepsy.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change at 16 weeks (4wks Titration + 12 wks Maintenance) compared to Baseline
primary_outcome.description: Percent change (PCH) in seizure frequency per 28d relative to Baseline, Treatment Phase (PCH[T]), Intent-to-Treat population.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change at 12 weeks (Maintenance Period) compared to Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Percent change in seizure frequency per 28 days relative to Baseline, Maintenance Period (PCH[M]), Intent-to-Treat population

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of 16 weeks (4 wks Titration + 12 wks Maintenance)
secondary_outcome.description: Percent of patients with a positive response, defined as a 50% or greater reduction in seizure frequency per 28 days relative to Baseline, Treatment Phase, Intent-to-Treat population

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of 16 weeks (4 wks Titration + 12 wks Maintenance)
secondary_outcome.description: Percent of patients seizure-free during Treatment Phase, Intent-to-Treat population

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of 12 weeks (Maintenance Period)
secondary_outcome.description: Percent of patients seizure-free during Maintenance, Intent-to-Treat population

arm_group.description: Placebo - four identical tablets taken orally once daily
2400mg OXC XR taken orally once daily as four identical tablets
1200mg OXC XR taken orally once daily as four identical tablets

intervention.description: Non-active tablet identical to study drug tablets
tablets containing 600mg OXC XR, identical to non-active tablets
two active tablets and two non-active tablets, all identical

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Capable of complying with the study procedures.
- Able to provide written informed consent
- Male or female aged 18 to 65 years, inclusive.
- Diagnosis of partial onset seizures
- Minimum of three seizures per 28 days
- Receiving treatment with 1-3 AEDs
- Refractory to at least one AED
- No progressive neurological conditions by recent MRI/CT
- Adequate birth control in women of child-bearing potential
Exclusion Criteria:
- Refractory to OXC for reasons of efficacy
- Recent status epilepticus
- Recent non-epileptic seizures
- Current diagnosis of major depression
- Recent suicidal plan or intent or more than one attempt
- Current use of oxcarbazepine, felbamate for < 18 months, phenytoin with levels >15mcg/mL or frequent need for rescue benzodiazepines
- Current use of sodium-lowering non-seizure medications.
- Clinically significant hepatic, renal, or cardiovascular function
- History of recent substance abuse
- Females who are pregnant or lactating.
- Hypersensitivity to OXC or related drugs
- Difficulty swallowing study medication

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Adult patients with refractory partial onset epilepsy were recruited from December 2009 to March 2011 at clinical sites in 8 countries.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Patients had at least three partial seizures per 28 days during an 8 week Baseline Period. Subjects were receiving treatment with one to three antiepileptic drugs and were on stable treatment for a minimum of 4 weeks. Subjects with a diagnosis other than partial epilepsy were excluded.

outcome.title: PCH(T), ITT
outcome.description: Percent change (PCH) in seizure frequency per 28d relative to Baseline, Treatment Phase (PCH[T]), Intent-to-Treat population.
outcome.time_frame: Change at 16 weeks (4wks Titration + 12 wks Maintenance) compared to Baseline
outcome.population: All safety population subjects with baseline Seizure Diary data and at least one visit during the Treatment Phase (ITT population). Subjects must have had at least 3 consecutive weeks of Seizure Diary data (SDD) in the Baseline Phase and at least 14 consecutive days of SDD after starting study drug.

measure.title: PCH(T), ITT
measure.description: Percent change (PCH) in seizure frequency per 28d relative to Baseline, Treatment Phase (PCH[T]), Intent-to-Treat population.
measure.population: All safety population subjects with baseline Seizure Diary data and at least one visit during the Treatment Phase (ITT population). Subjects must have had at least 3 consecutive weeks of Seizure Diary data (SDD) in the Baseline Phase and at least 14 consecutive days of SDD after starting study drug.

analysis.groups_desc: A Wilcoxon rank-sum test was used to test the hypothesis of equal median reduction in PCH(T) from baseline between SPN-804 and placebo. The sample size of 120 patients per treatment arm provides over 95% power to detect a difference of 31% to 42% between placebo and 2400mg SPN-804 at a two-sided 0.025 level for an overall Type I error rate of 0.050.
analysis.p_value_desc: P values reported are not adjusted for multiple comparisons. To preserve the overall Type I error-rate at 0.050, a step-up Hochberg procedure was used for the pair-wise comparisons.

analysis.groups_desc: A Wilcoxon rank-sum test was used to test the hypothesis of equal median reduction in PCH(T) from baseline between SPN-804 and placebo. The sample size of 120 patients per treatment arm provides over 95% power to detect a difference of 24% to 32% between placebo and 1200mg SPN-804 at a two-sided 0.025 level for an overall Type I error rate of 0.050.
analysis.p_value_desc: P values reported are not adjusted for multiple comparisons. To preserve the overall Type I error-rate at 0.050, a step-up Hochberg procedure was used for the pair-wise comparisons.

outcome.title: PCH(M)- ITT
outcome.description: Percent change in seizure frequency per 28 days relative to Baseline, Maintenance Period (PCH[M]), Intent-to-Treat population
outcome.time_frame: Change at 12 weeks (Maintenance Period) compared to Baseline
outcome.population: All safety population subjects with adequate baseline Seizure Diary data (at least three consecutive weeks) and at least one visit during the Titration Period and one visit during the Maintenance Period.

measure.title: PCH(M)- ITT
measure.description: Percent change in seizure frequency per 28 days relative to Baseline, Maintenance Period (PCH[M]), Intent-to-Treat population
measure.population: All safety population subjects with adequate baseline Seizure Diary data (at least three consecutive weeks) and at least one visit during the Titration Period and one visit during the Maintenance Period.

analysis.groups_desc: A Wilcoxon rank-sum test was used to test the hypothesis of equal median reduction in PCH(M) from baseline between SPN-804 and placebo. The sample size of 120 patients per treatment arm provides over 95% power to detect a difference of 31% to 42% between placebo and 2400mg SPN-804 at a two-sided 0.025 level for an overall Type I error rate of 0.050.
analysis.p_value_desc: P values reported are not adjusted for multiple comparisons. To preserve the overall Type I error-rate at 0.050, a step-up Hochberg procedure was used for the pair-wise comparisons.

analysis.groups_desc: A Wilcoxon rank-sum test was used to test the hypothesis of equal median reduction in PCH(M) from baseline between SPN-804 and placebo. The sample size of 120 patients per treatment arm provides over 95% power to detect a difference of 24% to 32% between placebo and 1200mg SPN-804 at a two-sided 0.025 level for an overall Type I error rate of 0.050.
analysis.p_value_desc: P values reported are not adjusted for multiple comparisons. To preserve the overall Type I error-rate at 0.050, a step-up Hochberg procedure was used for the pair-wise comparisons.

outcome.title: Responder Rate, ITT
outcome.description: Percent of patients with a positive response, defined as a 50% or greater reduction in seizure frequency per 28 days relative to Baseline, Treatment Phase, Intent-to-Treat population
outcome.time_frame: At the end of 16 weeks (4 wks Titration + 12 wks Maintenance)
outcome.population: All safety population subjects with baseline Seizure Diary data and at least one visit during the Treatment Phase (ITT population). Subjects must have had at least 3 consecutive weeks of Seizure Diary data (SDD) in the Baseline Phase and at least 14 consecutive days of SDD after starting study drug.

measure.title: Responder Rate, ITT
measure.description: Percent of patients with a positive response, defined as a 50% or greater reduction in seizure frequency per 28 days relative to Baseline, Treatment Phase, Intent-to-Treat population
measure.population: All safety population subjects with baseline Seizure Diary data and at least one visit during the Treatment Phase (ITT population). Subjects must have had at least 3 consecutive weeks of Seizure Diary data (SDD) in the Baseline Phase and at least 14 consecutive days of SDD after starting study drug.

analysis.groups_desc: The treatment response was analyzed using a logistic regression model with treatment group as a factor and country (or cluster), age, sex, and baseline seizure frequency per 28 days as explanatory variables.

The treatment response was analyzed using a logistic regression model with treatment group as a factor and country (or cluster), age, sex, and baseline seizure frequency per 28 days as explanatory variables.

outcome.title: Seizure-Free Rates, ITT
outcome.description: Percent of patients seizure-free during Treatment Phase, Intent-to-Treat population
outcome.time_frame: At the end of 16 weeks (4 wks Titration + 12 wks Maintenance)
outcome.population: All safety population subjects with baseline Seizure Diary data and at least one visit during the Treatment Phase (ITT population). Subjects must have had at least 3 consecutive weeks of Seizure Diary data (SDD) in the Baseline Phase and at least 14 consecutive days of SDD after starting study drug.

measure.title: Seizure-Free Rates, ITT
measure.description: Percent of patients seizure-free during Treatment Phase, Intent-to-Treat population
measure.population: All safety population subjects with baseline Seizure Diary data and at least one visit during the Treatment Phase (ITT population). Subjects must have had at least 3 consecutive weeks of Seizure Diary data (SDD) in the Baseline Phase and at least 14 consecutive days of SDD after starting study drug.

analysis.groups_desc: Pairwise comparisons of OXC XR 2400mg/day vs. placebo seizure-free rates during the Treatment Phase were made by means of Fisher’s exact test for the ITT population.
Pairwise comparisons of OXC XR 1200mg/day vs. placebo seizure-free rates during the Treatment Phase were made by means of Fisher's exact test for the ITT population.

outcome.title: Seizure Free Rate, ITT, (M)
outcome.description: Percent of patients seizure-free during Maintenance, Intent-to-Treat population
outcome.time_frame: At the end of 12 weeks (Maintenance Period)
outcome.population: All safety population subjects with adequate baseline Seizure Diary data (at least three consecutive weeks) and at least one visit during the Titration Period and one visit during the Maintenance Period.

measure.title: Seizure Free Rate, ITT, (M)
measure.description: Percent of patients seizure-free during Maintenance, Intent-to-Treat population
measure.population: All safety population subjects with adequate baseline Seizure Diary data (at least three consecutive weeks) and at least one visit during the Titration Period and one visit during the Maintenance Period.

analysis.groups_desc: Pairwise comparisons of OXC XR 2400mg/day vs. placebo seizure-free rates during the Maintenance Period were made by means of Fisher's exact test for the ITT population.
Pairwise comparisons of OXC XR 1200mg/day vs. placebo seizure-free rates during the Maintenance Period were made by means of Fisher's exact test for the ITT population.

reported_events.time_frame: All randomized subjects who took at least one dose of study drug.
reported_events.desc: Safety was assessed using adverse events (AEs), clinical laboratory results, vital signs, physical and neurological examinations, and electrocardiograms (ECGs).

group.title: 2400mg/Day SPN-804
group.description: 2400mg total daily dose of SPN-804O once a day (QD), given as four 600mg tablets

group.title: 1200mg/Day SPN-804
group.description: 1200mg total daily dose of SPN-804O QD, given as two 600mg tablets and two identical placebo tablets.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: placebo QD, given as four placebo tablets

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Stefan Schwabe, M.D., Ph.D., Chief Medical Officer
